image.altText: An Indian man wearing a green shirt with his left arm in a sling, sitting on a grey couch.

props.synopsis: Saurabh Anand feared he may have to leave Australia after a shocking machete attack saw him nearly lose his hand. However, the government has granted him a visa on compassionate grounds.

title.children: Victim of 'cowardly' alleged attack granted fresh Australian visa

image.altText: A graphic of a house being dropped on a conveyor belt.

props.synopsis: From early colonial settlers to the post-war construction boom, prefabricated and modular housing has a long history in Australia. Can factory-built homes fix our housing woes and help the climate?

title.children: There's a solution to build the housing we need, but we need to embrace it

image.altText: A group of police officers in yellow vests scuffle with people dressed in black in a city street.

props.synopsis: There were hostile scenes in Melbourne's CBD on Saturday morning several blocks from where a Women's Voices Australia rally was being held.

title.children: Counter protesters, police clash at rally held in Melbourne

image.altText: Jess Hill poses for a photo on a tan leather sofa wearing a black dress, her arms folded in front of her

props.synopsis: A Victorian writers festival's code of conduct has set a "dangerous precedent", one author says, after more than 50 writers and moderators withdrew from the event.

title.children: Writers festivals on notice after attempt to 'restrict speech' prompts exodus

image.altText: Blaithin Bogue celebrates the Kangaroos win over the Cats

props.synopsis: Blaithin Bogue surges in the fourth quarter and players report a flatter ball than usual as the Kangaroos start their AFLW premiership defence with a 30-point win over Geelong.

title.children: Players complain of flat ball as Irish debutant dazzles in Kangaroos' AFLW opener

image.altText: A elderly woman seated and holding a black and white photography of a young lady in roller skating shoes.

props.synopsis: In 1977, the ABC interviewed a 21-year-old rollerskater during a police crackdown on public nuisance, in a video that has since gone viral. Five decades later, we've tracked her down — and she still skates.

title.children: A viral clip returns a young Melbourne skater to the spotlight 50 years on

image.altText: A man and a woman in snow gear stand on skis in the mountains.

props.synopsis: Two cross-country skiers who were forced to spend a night in a blizzard following equipment failure warn other adventurers to be prepared for anything.

title.children: Skiers make lucky escape after spending night in blizzard

image.altText: James Peatling celebrates a goal for Adelaide against Collingwood.

props.synopsis: Adelaide has put one hand on the minor premiership with an impossibly tense win over Collingwood in front of 54,283 fans, the largest AFL crowd ever at the Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Crows hold on to beat Pies in front of record crowd

image.altText: A man stands in a living room that has a single bed and fireplace.

props.synopsis: In Cummeragunja, families live in decaying homes while children play on broken equipment. Frustrated by years of inaction, residents and elders are demanding repairs, accountability and recognition for a community deeply tied to Aboriginal history and identity.

title.children: Residents of historic village refuse to pay rent for crumbling homes

image.altText: On a red track in the desert, man runs amid green shubbery.

props.synopsis: After surviving his lowest point, 26-year-old Blake Bourne runs across the Simpson Desert, turning pain into purpose to raise awareness of mental health.

title.children: From dune to dune, man runs 380km to beat mental health struggles

image.altText: Moulamein player tackles Murrabit player

props.synopsis: Four clubs from NSW and Victoria in a regional football netball league that is set to close are approved to move to a new competition by their board, which says clubs' intrinsic value to their communities was a factor in the decision.

title.children: Football netball clubs in axed competition approved to join new league

image.altText: A man in a beige jumper holds a black and white lamb.

props.synopsis: Naturally coloured wool, the brainchild of a farmer in the 1970s, is used by craft enthusiasts around the world to be fashioned into all manner of things.

title.children: Saved from Sunday lunch, the coloured sheep loved by the craft world

image.altText: Showers spread through Melbourne on Friday as the first of two cold fronts arrived.

props.synopsis: This weekend will bring some of the coldest weather of the season, as a two-pronged pulse of polar air sweeps well north.

title.children: La Niña watch issued as eastern Australia braces for more rain, snow

image.altText: Sydney Swans AFLW star Chloe Molloy bends over, yells and pumps her fists in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans begin their AFLW campaign with a spirited win over Richmond thanks to starring performances from Chloe Molloy and debutant Zippy Fish.

title.children: Four goal blast from Chloe Molloy on AFLW return as Swans beat Tigers

image.altText: The portait shows three young people appearing to play outside.

props.synopsis: An image of three First Nations girls gesturing with their middle fingers towards the camera, highlighting the issue of Indigenous children in youth detention, wins the National Photographic Portrait Prize.

title.children: Portrait prize winner highlights plight of Indigenous youth detainees

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands outside the Supreme Court

props.synopsis: The fake submissions included fabricated quotes from a speech to the state legislature and non-existent case citations purportedly from Victoria's Supreme Court.

title.children: Senior lawyer files AI-generated submissions in Victorian teen murder case

image.altText: Portrait of smiling man with brown hair, brown eyes.

props.synopsis: A 72-year-old man charged with killing Warrnambool man Christopher Jarvis nearly 20 years ago has been granted bail.

title.children: Man accused of Victorian father's cold case murder granted bail

image.altText: Fremantle star Nat Fyfe waves to the crowd as he walks off the ground, passing a guard of honour of players and his family.

props.synopsis: Fremantle's 57-point loss to Brisbane puts the Dockers' finals hopes on thin ice, meaning champion Nat Fyfe may not get one final crack at a premiership.

title.children: No Fyfe farewell yet: Longmuir bullish on finals hopes despite big loss to Lions

image.altText: Woman looking downcast in an ABC studio

props.synopsis: Writers scheduled to appear at the event in central Victoria this weekend are refusing to turn up because of a code of conduct they believe limits freedom of speech.

title.children: Festival opening night gala cancelled as writers pull out over censorship fears

image.altText: A large, square, sandy coloured building with a sign reading "Mildura Law Courts". The sun is bright.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old Victorian man with a history of breaching bail and family violence orders will be under the supervision of his grandmother while he awaits an appeal.

title.children: Man jailed for assault and stalking given bail to attend funeral

image.altText: Bees with little mites on them.

props.synopsis: The devastating varroa mite has been detected in Gippsland bee hives.

title.children: Varroa mite bee parasite spreads to south-east Victoria

image.altText: Deb knelt next to a stone headstone.

props.synopsis: Months after New South Wales became the first state to reform the "outdated" law banning people from being laid to rest with their pets, advocates are urging the Victorian government to catch up.

title.children: 'I broke the law again today': Calls to reform pet burial laws

image.altText: A black and white image of a man sitting indoors smiling in a black puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: The former boss of Genius Childcare, which owes creditors millions of dollars, has pleaded guilty to dealing with proceeds of crime.

title.children: Former childcare boss pleads guilty to dealing with suspected proceeds of crime

image.altText: Formula and Baby Bottles. Infant milk formula on kitchen background

props.synopsis: Police allege people on student and temporary visas have been stealing baby formula, medicines and vitamins from supermarkets in Melbourne, and then passing them to others who then on-sell the items for profit.

title.children: $10m theft of baby formula and other items from Melbourne supermarkets

image.altText: Serious young man in a navy uniform with a HMAS Canberra hat on, coloured photo, vintage, trees in the background.

props.synopsis: The last survivor of the HMAS Canberra is farewelled on Victory in the Pacific Day, which marks the end of hostilities in the Pacific region during World War II.

title.children: HMAS Canberra survivor buried on 80th anniversary marking end of WWII

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing glasses and short hair.

props.synopsis: It is believed Annette Brennan's body was put into a wheelie bin that was collected from a home in Coolaroo in 2024.

title.children: Manslaughter plea over death of woman whose body was found at Melbourne tip

image.altText: A keeper sits near a rhinoceres in its enclosure.

props.synopsis: As bushfires raged in the Grampians/Gariwerd National Park last summer, nearby zookeepers were working to protect their animals.

title.children: How zoo keepers care for animals during a bushfire emergency

image.altText: mine operations and lots of equipment

props.synopsis: A Victorian court hears noise from the state's biggest gold mine has made a couple's Axedale home a "living hell".

title.children: Home turned into 'place of torture' by gold mine, court hears

image.altText: A man in a burnt out forest.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action restructure is expected to affect 350 jobs in agriculture, solar, bushfire and forest services.

title.children: Victorian government cuts 350 jobs in environment department restructure

image.altText: An artist's render of a development at Melbourne's Queen Vic Markets

props.synopsis: Federal approval has been granted for a major new housing development near the Queen Victoria Market likely to unlock thousands of homes.

title.children: Low-cost housing, student accommodation to be built near Queen Vic Market

image.altText: Archie Wilson crying during a press conference for University of Nebraska.

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Archie Wilson, who is chasing a dream of being a punter in American football, has broken down while discussing living away from his family.

title.children: Homesickness takes toll on Australian chasing American football dream

image.altText: A black and white photos of a young woman with brown hair, close up on her face.

props.synopsis: Police arrest and charge a 67-year-old man over the 1994 murder of 24-year-old Castlemaine woman Samantha Mizzi.

title.children: Police charge 67yo with murder in 1994 Melbourne cold case

image.altText: A sketch of a man with dark hair and a dark beard in a dark t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Athena Georgopoulos and her partner Andrew Gunn at a unit in Mount Waverley on Monday night faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man accused of murdering pregnant woman and partner faces Melbourne court

image.altText: An irrigation channel flows away from camera into the distance.

props.synopsis: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority argues it acted conservatively to manage the risks of water shortfalls, including the use of over-bank flows, in its defence against a class action brought by 28,000 irrigators.

title.children: MDBA defends deliberate forest flooding in billion-dollar class action

image.altText: A generic photo of a children's toy truck laying sideways, with a colourful abacus in the background.

props.synopsis: Children's commissioner Anne Hollonds says regulations are far too weak in a sector supposed to care for Australia's youngest and most vulnerable citizens.

title.children: Government scrambles to revoke check after latest childcare allegations surface
